intro: Pimpinella renifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows and woodland edges. It is often used in herbal medicine for its potential digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The species is also valued in ecological gardens for its role in supporting pollinators.
